intro: Stilpnophytum axillare, commonly known as the axillary spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Stilpnophytum axillare is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
